content:
ServiceEndpoint Class

In this Article

Represents the endpoint for a service that allows clients of the service to find and communicate with the service.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("Address={address}")]
[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("Name={name}")]
public class ServiceEndpoint

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ServiceEndpoint

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

The service endpoint contains the information about the address, binding, contract, and behavior required by a client to find and interact with the service at this endpoint.

Constructors summary

ServiceEndpoint(ContractDescription)

Initializes a new instance of the ServiceEndpoint class for a specified contract.
ServiceEndpoint(ContractDescription,Binding,EndpointAddress)

Initializes a new instance of the ServiceEndpoint class with a specified contract, binding, and address.

Properties summary

Address

Gets or sets the endpoint address for the service endpoint.
Behaviors

Gets the behaviors for the service endpoint.
Binding

Gets or sets the binding for the service endpoint.
Contract

Gets the contract for the service endpoint.
EndpointBehaviors

Gets the endpoint behaviors for the service.
IsSystemEndpoint

Gets or sets whether the service endpoint is generated by the system as opposed to being user-defined.
ListenUri

Gets or sets the URI at which the service endpoint listens.
ListenUriMode

Gets or sets how the transport handles the URI that is provided for the service to listen on.
Name

Gets or sets the name of the service endpoint.

Constructors

  • ServiceEndpoint(ContractDescription)

    Initializes a new instance of the ServiceEndpoint class for a specified contract.

    public ServiceEndpoint (System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription contract);

    Parameters

    • contract
      ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription for the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    Use this constructor when the binding and address for the endpoint are provided in configuration.

    Example

    			Dim cd As New ContractDescription("Calculator")
			Dim svcEndpoint As New ServiceEndpoint(cd)

                ContractDescription cd = new ContractDescription("Calculator");
            ServiceEndpoint svcEndpoint = new ServiceEndpoint(cd);
  • ServiceEndpoint(ContractDescription,Binding,EndpointAddress)

    Initializes a new instance of the ServiceEndpoint class with a specified contract, binding, and address.

    public ServiceEndpoint (System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription contract, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding, System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress address);

    Parameters

    • contract
      ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription for the service endpoint.

    • binding
      Binding

      The Binding that specifies how the service endpoint communicates with the world.

    • address
      EndpointAddress

      The EndpointAddress for the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    Use this constructor to specify a service endpoint imperatively in code.

    Example

                string address = "http://localhost:8001/CalculatorService";

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = new ServiceEndpoint(
                ContractDescription.GetContract(
                    typeof(ICalculator), 
                    typeof(CalculatorService)), 
                    new WSHttpBinding(), 
                    new EndpointAddress(address));

    			Dim address As String = "http://localhost:8001/CalculatorService"

			Dim endpoint As New ServiceEndpoint(ContractDescription.GetContract(GetType(ICalculator), GetType(CalculatorService)), New WSHttpBinding(), New EndpointAddress(address))

Properties

  • Address

    Gets or sets the endpoint address for the service endpoint.

    public System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress Address { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • EndpointAddress

      The EndpointAddress that specifies the location of the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    The default value of ListenUri at which the service endpoint listens is provided by Uri of the EndpointAddress returned by Address.

    Example

    The following example shows how to add a ServiceEndpoint to an existing ServiceHost and display the address property: 

    			Dim endpnt As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Address: {0}", endpnt.Address)

                ServiceEndpoint endpnt = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Address: {0}", endpnt.Address);
  • Behaviors

    Gets the behaviors for the service endpoint.

    public System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection<System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> Behaviors { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedByTypeCollection<IEndpointBehavior>

      The stem.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1 of type IEndpointBehavior that contains the behaviors specified for the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    The type of behavior that is accessible from the description hierarchy is scoped to the specific level. From the ServiceEndpoint the IEndpointBehavior is accessible.

    If you want access to the IContractBehavior associated with an endpoint, you can obtain the contact for the endpoint using the Contract property. Then call the Behaviors property to obtain the KeyedByTypeCollection<TItem> of the IContractBehavior objects associated with the endpoint.

    Example

    The following code demonstrates how to add a custom endpoint behavior and then access that behavior. 

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            endpoint.Behaviors.Add(new MyEndpointBehavior());

            Console.WriteLine("List all behaviors:");
            foreach (IEndpointBehavior behavior in endpoint.Behaviors)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("Behavior: {0}", behavior.ToString());
            }

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			endpoint.Behaviors.Add(New MyEndpointBehavior())

			Console.WriteLine("List all behaviors:")
			For Each behavior As IEndpointBehavior In endpoint.Behaviors
				Console.WriteLine("Behavior: {0}", CType(behavior, Object).ToString())
			Next behavior
  • Binding

    Gets or sets the binding for the service endpoint.

    public System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding Binding { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Binding

      The Binding for the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    The binding for an endpoint can also be specified in the configuration file in the <bindings> element.

    Example

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name);
            Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString());

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name)
			Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString())
  • Contract

    Gets the contract for the service endpoint.

    public System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription Contract { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ContractDescription

      The ContractDescription that specifies the contract for the service endpoint.

    Remarks

    Each service endpoint has a unique contract. From the ContractDescription, the OperationDescriptionCollection for the methods contained in the contract can be accessed using the Operations property.

    Example

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name);
            Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString());

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name)
			Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString())
  • EndpointBehaviors

    Gets the endpoint behaviors for the service.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.KeyedCollection<Type,System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> EndpointBehaviors { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedCollection<Type,IEndpointBehavior>

      The endpoint behaviors for the service.

  • IsSystemEndpoint

    Gets or sets whether the service endpoint is generated by the system as opposed to being user-defined.

    public bool IsSystemEndpoint { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the service endpoint is generated by the system; otherwise, false.

  • ListenUri

    Gets or sets the URI at which the service endpoint listens.

    public Uri ListenUri { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      The Uri at which the service endpoint listens. The default value is provided by stem.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Uri* of the EndpointAddress returned by stem.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Address*.

    Remarks

    The value can also be set using the ListenUri property.

    Example

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name);
            Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString());

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name)
			Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString())
  • ListenUriMode

    Gets or sets how the transport handles the URI that is provided for the service to listen on.

    public System.ServiceModel.Description.ListenUriMode ListenUriMode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ListenUriMode

      The ListenUriMode for the service endpoint. The default value is ListenUriMode.

    Remarks

    The value of the ListenUriMode is used to determine how the transport handles the ListenUri.

    Example

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name);
            Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString());

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name)
			Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString())
  • Name

    Gets or sets the name of the service endpoint.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name the service endpoint. The default value is the concatenation of the binding name and the contract description name. For example, stem.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding.Name* +'_' + stem.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Name*.

    Remarks

    Services may have multiple endpoints, so the endpoint Name is distinct from the name of the service. The service name is accessed using the Name property.

    Note

    When accessed from the service, this property is populated by the configuration element. When accessed on the client, this property is null. When the property getter is called (again on the client) it populates this property with a default value based on the contract and binding.

    Example

                Uri baseAddress = new Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple");
            ServiceHost serviceHost = new ServiceHost(typeof(CalculatorService), baseAddress);

            ServiceEndpoint endpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(
                typeof(ICalculator),
                new WSHttpBinding(),
                "CalculatorServiceObject");

            Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name);
            Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString());

    			Dim baseAddress As New Uri("http://localhost:8001/Simple")
			Dim serviceHost As New ServiceHost(GetType(CalculatorService), baseAddress)

			Dim endpoint As ServiceEndpoint = serviceHost.AddServiceEndpoint(GetType(ICalculator), New WSHttpBinding(), "CalculatorServiceObject")

			Console.WriteLine("Service endpoint {0} contains the following:", endpoint.Name)
			Console.WriteLine("Binding: {0}", endpoint.Binding.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("Contract: {0}", endpoint.Contract.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUri: {0}", endpoint.ListenUri.ToString())
			Console.WriteLine("ListenUriMode: {0}", endpoint.ListenUriMode.ToString())
